intro: Deutzia ogatae, commonly known as the Japanese deutzia, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It features clusters of fragrant, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, arching stems and elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soil. Deutzia ogatae is valued for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in partial shade.
